name: North Crocker Mountain

trails_config.name: Appalachian Trail from Route 27
trails_config.description: A long, steady climb along the AT. While the summit is wooded, there is a viewpoint just past the peak looking towards Sugarloaf.
trails_config.parking_info: Route 27 AT Crossing, Carrabassett Valley, ME

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of Maine on North Crocker Mountain. At 4228 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4228 feet, North Crocker Mountain is a standout peak in Maine. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Appalachian Trail from Route 27**, a **10.6 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **Maine 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **South Crocker Mountain**, which is just 1.4 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
